author: Michelle Mann mmann@dothaneagle.com
title: Ozark man seeks damages for 'false arrest'
text: OZARK-An Ozark man is seeking damages against the city on multiple claims, including a violation of his civil rights. Bryant Louis Fontenot is seeking $3 million from the city of Ozark for “false imprisonment, negligence, false arrest, outrage abuse of process, malicious prosecution, emotional distress, humiliation, loss of enjoyment of life, pain, suffering, and violations of my civil rights,” according to a notarized affidavit sent from Fontenot and his attorney Andrew Scarborough to the Dale County seat. The written communication from Fontenot has been received by the city, City of Ozark Attorney Joe W. Adams confirmed Thursday. The city declines comment on the matter at this time, he said. The demand for $3 million comes on the heels of a municipal court case filed against Fontenot by the city on behalf of Ozark Mayor Mark Blankenship, charging harassment in connection with a dialogue between the two men outside of the city municipal building after a Jan. 2 city council meeting. People are also reading… When Fontenot responded to the harassment charge with a request for a trial, the Ozark City Council unanimously approved the hiring of a specially appointed judge and prosecutor to hear the matter after being told that the municipal attorneys had recused themselves. At the day-long trial before specially appointed Municipal Judge Barbara Wade of Daleville held in the municipal courtroom at Ozark City Hall Feb. 7, specially appointed prosecutor Rick Hollingsworth Jr. of Enterprise represented the city of Ozark. In a written judgement dated Feb. 15, Wade dismissed the case against Fontenot and granted his motion for acquittal, citing lack of evidence on the part of the city’s witnesses — including some city employees and police officers — that harassment had occurred. In his April 18 affidavit sent to the city, Fontenot reiterated what had been testified to in municipal court, including his reaction to news of the charges against him. “On Jan. 5, I was contacted by the Ozark Police Department and informed that I had a warrant for my arrest and that I should turn myself into authorities,” Fontenot said in the affidavit. “This was a shock to me. I have had no such encounters with the law and being advised that I now have a warrant out for my arrest, a sense of shame came upon me that lasted until my case was resolved with my full and absolute acquittal.” The retired Army Chief Warrant Officer 5 with 23 years of military service said that when he turned himself into the city magistrate, he was advised that “my freedom to travel was now suspended and my freedom as to whom I may or not speak was restricted,” and “Due to being arrested, I was forced to obtain legal representation.” Citing the Civil Rights Act of 1871, the affidavit serves as notice to the city that Fontenot intends to pursue the matter in the legal system.

author: Heraldo de Aragón
title: Hamás anuncia que acepta la propuesta de Egipto y Qatar para un alto el fuego en Gaza
text: Oriente próximo Hamás anuncia que acepta la propuesta de Egipto y Qatar para un alto el fuego en Gaza El anuncio se produce pocas horas después de que Israel iniciara la evacuación de la población palestina de Rafá con vistas al comienzo de una ofensiva militar. El Movimiento de Resistencia Islámica ( [Hamás](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/temas/hamas.html)) ha anunciado este lunes que acepta la última propuesta de alto el fuego para la Franja de Gaza planteada por los países mediadores Qatar y Egipto. El líder político de Hamás, Ismail Haniye, ha trasladado esta decisión al ministro de Asuntos Exteriores qatarí, Mohamed bin Abulrahman al Zani, y al ministro de Inteligencia egipcio, Abbas Kamel, según un comunicado de Hamás recogido por medios palestinos afines. El anuncio se produce pocas horas después de que Israel iniciara la evacuación de la población palestina de Rafá con vistas al comienzo de una ofensiva militar contra el que consideran último reducto de Hamás en la Franja de Gaza. En el Rafá hay más de 1,2 millones de desplazados como consecuencia de la entrada de tropas israelíes que han ido barriendo de norte a sur el enclave palestino. [Regístrate gratis](#) [Iniciar sesión](#)

author: ТОЛК
title: Что известно о нападении мужчины с ножом на медработников в Иркутске - Толк 03.07.2025
text:
По словам главврача больницы, где все произошло, данный пациент уже не раз угрожал персоналу. Также его отправляли в психдиспансер
В Иркутске задержали мужчину, который напал на сотрудников медицинского учреждения, сообщает пресс-служба регионального отделения ГУ МВД России.
Нападение случилось утром 3 июля в Ленинском округе областного центра. Предварительно, пострадали две женщины. В Следкоме возбудили уголовное дело о покушении на убийство.
На видео, опубликованном в telegram-канале МВД, нападавший рассказывает, что хотел убить врача и совершил нападение с ножом и газовым баллончиком.
По словам мужчины, его "лишили права на жизнь по Конституции и Конвенции ООН о правах инвалидов". Когда задержанному сказали, что это не повод нападать на людей, гражданин ответил, что ему "наверное, виднее".
Главный врач иркутской городской больницы № 8 Жанна Есева, где произошел инцидент, поделилась с "ИрСити" историей произошедшего и информацией о состоянии раненых.
"Пациент напал на моего заместителя, начмеда поликлиники и секретаря. Пришел за документами с ножом, с баллончиком. Брызнул в лицо, в глаза баллончиком, достал нож и нанес ножевые ранения в область лица, затылка, шеи и грудного отдела и секретарю, и моему заместителю", – сообщила она.
Жанна Есева отметила, что данный пациент состоит на учете в психдиспансере и уже не раз появлялся с угрозами. Сотрудники же находятся в тяжелом состоянии. Их оперируют в больнице.
Ранее сообщалось, как сибирячка вышла из тюрьмы и в тот же день убила мужчину из-за стука в дверь.
Все подростки учились в одной школе, но в разных классах. Подозреваемому было 17 лет, а его жертвами стали два 14-летних мальчика, 13-летний подросток и 16-летняя школьница

author: Merkur.de
title: Meghan Markles „magische Blumenstreusel" bieten Steilvorlage für lustige Parodien
text:
Meghan Markles „magische Blumenstreusel“ bieten Steilvorlage für lustige Parodien
Mit ihren fragwürdigen Lifestyle-Tipps sorgte Meghan Markle zuletzt für hämische Kommentare. Während eines Auftritts verteidigte die Herzogin jetzt unter anderem ihre vielfach kritisierte Blumendeko.
New York – Ihre Netflix-Show „With Love, Meghan“ sollte Meghan Markle (43) eigentlich als Expertin in Lifestyle-Fragen etablieren. Der Versuch ging jedoch ziemlich nach hinten los, denn die Ehefrau von Prinz Harry (40) machte sich mit ihren seltsam anmutenden Küchentipps in den sozialen Netzwerken zum Gespött der Zuschauer. Insbesondere die essbaren getrockneten Blüten, die laut Meghan selbst den einfachsten Gerichten einen Gourmet-Anstrich verleihen, führten im Netz zu zahlreichen Parodien.
Meghans „magische Blumenstreusel“ sorgen für Lacher auf Social Media
Eines steht fest: „With Love, Meghan“ hat die Herzogin von Sussex zweifelsohne wieder einmal ins Gespräch gebracht. Seit der Veröffentlichung der Netflix-Produktion häufen sich die Satire-Posts auf Instagram, TikTok und Co., wobei vor allem die „magischen Blumenstreusel“ der zweifachen Mutter für Kopfschütteln sorgen. Bei der fraglichen Essensdeko handelt es sich um getrocknete Blüten, die Meghan liebend gerne über Rührei, Salate und Joghurtspeisen streut.
Dass sie selbst ganz und gar überzeugt von der beeindruckenden Wirkung ihrer essbaren Blumen ist, veranlasste seitdem zahlreiche Social-Media-Nutzer zu Parodien von „With Love, Meghan“. Kurzerhand werden Blütenblätter jetzt über alles gestreut – auch auf das Butterbrot. Während eines öffentlichen Auftritts in New York verteidigte Meghan ihre „magischen Blumenstreusel“ jetzt jedoch vehement.
Laut Meghan sind die getrockneten Blüten mehr als nur Deko auf dem Teller
Beim „Time100“-Gipfel bezeichnete Meghan Markle ihre vielfach kritisierten Blütenstreusel als eine Art „Analogie“, denn laut der Herzogin stehen die essbaren Blumen für mehr als nur Deko. „Lasst uns über die Blumenstreusel reden“, erklärte Meghan „The Daily Beast“-Berichten zufolge im Gespräch mit „Time“-CEO Jessica Sibley, „denn ich glaube es geht um die kleinen Momente der Freude, die so mühelos sind und einfach das kleine bisschen Magie erschaffen, nach dem wir uns alle in unserem Alltag sehnen.“
Offenbar scheint Meghan also eine regelrechte Philosophie in ihren Blumenstreuseln zu sehen. Dass zahlreiche Social-Media-User anderer Meinung sind, interessiert die Ex-Schauspielerin dagegen nur wenig. Angesprochen auf die Parodien im Netz, entgegnete sie amüsiert mit einem Zitat der Komikerin Tina Fey (54): „Wenn du jemals anfängst zufrieden mit dir zu sein, gibt es dieses Ding namens Internet, da kannst du viele Menschen finden, die dich nicht mögen.“ In Zukunft könnten Meghan Markle und Prinz Harry übrigens ihre Titel verlieren. Verwendete Quellen: thedailybeast.com, TikTok

author: @nbc6
title: Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas accepted gifts worth millions of dollars over 20 years, analysis finds
text:
Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas accepted millions of dollars’ worth of gifts over two decades on the bench, according to a new data analysis. The figure sets Thomas far apart from his current colleagues, according to the nonprofit Fix the Court. The analysis provides fodder for the Supreme Court critics, who have called for reforms in the wake of a series of politically incendiary rulings and ongoing ethics scandals. Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas accepted millions of dollars’ worth of gifts over the past two decades on the bench, a total nearly 10 times the value of all gifts received by his fellow justices during the same time, according to a new analysis.
Thomas received 103 gifts with a total value of more than $2.4 million between 2004 and 2023, the judicial reform group Fix the Court said in its report Thursday.
In contrast, Thomas’ fellow justices over the same period accepted a total of just 93 gifts worth a combined value of only about $248,000, according to the non-profit group.
Thomas’ fellow conservative justice, Samuel Alito, accounted for the lion’s share of that value. Fix the Court’s analysis found that Alito accepted 16 gifts worth a combined $170,095.
Fix the Court identified another 101 “likely gifts” — with a total estimated value of almost $1.8 million —that Thomas received in the form of free trips and lodging from the billionaire businessman Harlan Crow, and at the exclusive Bohemian Grove club.
Counting those gifts, Thomas’ total two-decade haul is valued at nearly $4.2 million.
Fix the Court’s analysis is largely based on investigative reporting by the media outlet ProPublica over the past year, which has been focused on Thomas and Alito, and which has sparked calls for ethics reform at the Supreme Court.
The group also factored in data from the Congressional Record, the justices’ annual financial disclosures, other news sources, and its own law clerk-led research.
The value and number of gifts Thomas received also eclipsed those accepted by eight retired or dead Supreme Court justices whose tenures overlapped his service on the court, which began in 1991.
The late Justice Sandra Day O’Connor, who served more than 34 years on the court, received 73 gifts until she retired in early 2006, putting her in second place behind Thomas in total number of gifts.
But the combined value of O’Connor’s gifts was less than $36,000.
Antonin Scalia, a conservative justice who died in 2016 while still on the court, accepted 67 gifts worth about $210,000 during his tenure, which began in 1986.
The late Chief Justice William Rehnquist, whose career on the court spanned 33 years until 2005, accepted just six gifts, with a total value of less than $13,000.
“Supreme Court justices should not be accepting gifts, let alone the hundreds of freebies worth millions of dollars they’ve received over the years,” said Fix the Court executive director Gabe Roth in a statement.
“The ethics crisis at the Court won’t begin to abate until justices adopt stricter gift acceptance rules,” Roth said.
Fix the Court noted that the total figures it calculated for gift values are likely lower than the actual values because the analysis erred on the low end of the cost of some gifts, such as free travel or tickets to sports games.
Its tally also makes some assumptions. The group assumed the cost per hour of a flight on a private plane is $10,000, for instance, and it counted each leg of a roundtrip flight as a separate gift.
The Supreme Court did not immediately respond to CNBC’s request for comment on Fix the Court’s findings.
ProPublica first revealed that Thomas had accepted years of luxury trips from the Republican megadonor Crow without reporting them on his financial disclosures, which ethics experts said he was required to do.
Thomas said his judicial colleagues had told him that he did not have to disclose those travel expenses.
The analysis nevertheless provides fodder for the Supreme Court’s increasingly vocal critics, who have called for reforms in the wake of a series of politically incendiary rulings and ongoing ethics scandals .
The court under Chief Justice John Roberts has made some concessions, including adopting a formal — though unenforceable — code of ethics in November.
The court in that document aimed to “dispel” the “misunderstanding” that the court’s nine justices “regard themselves as unrestricted by any ethics rules.”
The federal judiciary, meanwhile, implemented new rules this year requiring Supreme Court justices to disclose the value of travel-related gifts on their financial disclosure forms.

author: @httweets
title: First body shamed and then discriminated by Cong over my Muslim identity: Zeeshan | Mumbai news
text: Zeeshan Siddique, who was removed as the Congress’ Mumbai youth wing chief, has alleged that “injustice is being done to Muslims within a party that claims to have secular credentials. The Bandra East MLA was sacked from the post after his father and former MLA Baba Siddique joined the NCP’s Ajit Pawar faction. Zeeshan was seen at the ceremony where his father joined the NCP, and NCP leaders claimed they would soon get him to join as well.During a press conference on Thursday, Zeeshan alleged that he was dislodged from his post because his father Baba Siddique had joined the NCP–he demanded to know why the same logic was not applied to Rahul Gandhi when Sanjay Gandhi’s family joined the BJP (he was alluding to Gandhi’s wife Maneka and son Varun).He spent a significant portion of the press conference attacking the Congress, directing his ire at party leaders. Siddiqui said that soon after he was denied the post of Youth Congress chief for nearly eight months despite having a won an election to that office by a margin of over 20,000 votes.“I had secured 88,517 votes in my Youth Congress chief election. But there was a huge delay in my appointment. Apart from me, injustice was done to Mohammed Nalpad, who was elected as Youth Congress president in Karnataka,” he said. “Congress has no values. If Congress has problems with Muslims, then they must stop claiming that they are with Muslims.” He claimed that there communalism pervaded the Congress party more than any other political unit and added that the Mumbai wing has never had a Muslim president. “When Milind Deora stepped down as president of Mumbai Congress, names of possible presidents were discussed. Muslim leaders like Naseem Khan, Aslam Shaikh, Amin Patel, and Baba Siddique were not considered. The Congress does not prioritise minorities,” he said.He alleged that after he was elected Mumbai Youth Congress president, he was told not to elect more than two Muslim district youth presidents; with a warning that doing so would jeopardise his own position. “Why is Congress making a farce claiming they are with Muslims?” he questioned.Zeeshan went on to charge the party of attacks that were personal in nature, claiming that he was body-shamed during Rahul Gandhi’s Bharat Jodo Yatra when “someone close to Rahul Gandhi” forbade him from accompanying the leader unless he “first lost 10 kilos”. The state Congress party countered Zeeshan’s claims. “We gave him an MLA ticket and made him Youth Congress chief of Mumbai. Was this injustice?” said Maharashtra Congress spokesperson Atul Londhe.Congress chief Varsha Gaikwad added, “Allegations raised by colleague Zeeshan Siddique against the Congress party and our leaders are most unfortunate and far from the truth.”She went on to say: “It is also regrettable that Zeeshan has chosen to level such baseless allegations at a time when Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi and the Congress Parivar are fighting wholeheartedly to preserve the secular, democratic, and progressive idea of India, against the corrupt, divisive, and hate-filled politics of the RSS-BJP and its alliance partners. I would once again urge Zeeshan to introspect and not act under the influence of those out to destroy the idea of India.”
